result.execSummary:
All charges against Stevie Brookshire in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Stevie Brookshire is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

Defendant Stevie Brookshire in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Stevie Brookshire in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case in court with 14CF4416 and 16CF608.  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders case DISMISSED with prejudice.

Defendant Stevie Brookshire in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Stevie Brookshire in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for final pretrial.  Defense requests to convert jury trial date to a projected guilty plea date.  State has no objection. Court orders case adjourned to Branch 45.  Plea hearing scheduled for February 22, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Stevie Brookshire in court with attorney Andrew Joel Golden.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In chambers conversation with both parties.  Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Court GRANTED additional GPS release for medical with prior notice to Justice Point. Court further GRANTED additional GPS release to allow defendant to go to government buildings from Monday through Friday from 9:00 AM to 4:00 PM with prior notice to Justice Point. Received & Filed, Notice of Motion and Motion for Bail Modification. ADA Piotrowski notified, defense counsel requested for bail motion hearing granted. Case set for 6/18/2015 at 8:30 AM in branch 23.

Defendant Stevie Darrell Brookshire NOT in court with attorney Andrew Joel Golden.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin. FILE NOT IN COURT. Case called at request of Defense Counsel, matter not scheduled for today. Defense counsel waived defendant's appearance for today's hearing only.  Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed. This is a rotation substitution. Court consented to substitution against Judge KREMERS.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court, effective 8/1/2015, this case is reassigned pursuant to current court rules to Judge Wagner, Br. 38. Court VACATED the Jury Trial date of 8/17/2015. Case is temporarily assigned to Judge Flanagan, branch 04, Judge Wagner branch 38 will be taking over that calendar. Case set for Status Conference in branch 23.  Status conference scheduled for July 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Stevie Brookshire in court with attorney Andrew Joel Golden.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court. Court allowed for additional release on GPS monitoring for purposed of attending job interviews with prior arrangement through Justice Point. If defendant finds employment, the court grants release for employment. Case remains set for Jury Trial on 8/17/2015. Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to a branch of the Circuit Court to be determined.

Defendant Stevie Brookshire in court with attorney Andrew Joel Golden.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
JUDGE BOROWKSI FOR JUDGE GRADY IN BRANCH 23

Court further set case for a bail hearing before branch 23.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Received & Filed, Notice of Motion and Motion for Bail Modification. Case set for Bail Review Hearing on 5/12/2015 at 1:30 PM in branch 23. Parties advised.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY ORDERED, to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers. No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription. Comply with No Contact Order.
Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.

Defendant Stevie Brookshire in court with attorney Andrew Joel Golden.  Defendant Stevie Brookshire in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Jury Trial. State requested an adjournment of the Jury Trail. Defense motion to Dismiss. Court GRANTED state's motion and DENIED defense motion. Case is adjourned for Jury Trial to branch 23. Arguments as to bail. Court set at bond at $1,000.00 CASH with turnover to Justice Point, same conditions as pending case 14CF4416.

Attorney Andrew Joel Golden in court, defendant Stevie Brookshire not in court, in custody.  Ben Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court ordered witnesses sequestered.  Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #14CF4416. Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Officer William Schmitz.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. Defense requested Jury Trial date in branch 23. Parties advised of deadlines as to filing of motions as turnover of discovery. State's motion for joinder of 15CF322 & 14CF4416, GRANTED. Case is adjourned to Branch 23.  Jury trial scheduled for April 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
